sen.j: 14世紀前後の北九州から朝鮮半島、中国沿岸などでは日本人、中国人や朝鮮民族らの多民族構成とする倭寇（前期倭寇）が活発化し、日朝貿易においては朝貢貿易に加えて民間貿易も許可されていたため、東アジアの海上世界は民族雑居状態が存在していた。
sen.e: Beginning around the fourteenth century, the Wako (specifically, the early Wako, "Wako" being a term that literally means "Japanese pirates"), a multiethnic group of pirates that included Japanese, Chinese, and Koreans, increased their activities in the areas from northern Kyushu in Japan to around the Korean peninsula and along the coast of China; trade between Japan and Korea by private merchants, in addition to the formal tributary trade missions, had begun to be permitted, which created a more international flavor in the maritime world of East Asia during this period.

sen.e: During the days of the early Wako, the Korean peninsula was both one of their main targets and their base of operations, and because the Joseon Dynasty in Korea had just been formed, the new government lacked the independent ability to preserve peace, which meant it was extremely difficult for them to suppress Wako pirate activity.
